channel.title: Comments on: Bringing Feminism to Dungeons and Dragons
channel.description: Stellar Short Fiction by Women-Identified Writers Since 2010

item.title: By: Sarah
item.dc:creator: Sarah
item.description:
This seems kinda weird tbh. I'm all for being inclusive, but saying crap like guy DMs tend to have "continuous HULK-SMASH battles" is blatantly sexist. Feminism, as I understand it, is equality for all. You shouldn't disparage male DMs, let alone male players, for that. We shouldnt try to convince peeps to go for male or female characters regardless of the group, and we sure as hell shouldn't only focus on the idea of *only* respecting women.
We shouldnt relate dnd to the real world in my opinion. If a straight white guy wants to play a gay black guy without being offensive, whats wrong with it? It's a game at the end of the day, and shouldn't have repercussions in real life if your being a good person bout it.
Equal chance to play, equal respect for all, and equal love for this awesome game. That's how it should go. Not favoring one side over another. Especially with how dnd has become so much more diverse, with the idea of it being dominated by cis white males out the window a long time ago.

item.title: By: scott kriegan
item.dc:creator: scott kriegan
item.description: It would be cool to play with a diverse group, I started playing in the 1980's up until around 1998 and back then it was only male. I couldn't even get my girlfriend at the time to play. Things have changed and for the better.
